intro: Achyrothalamus, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. These plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. They typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The genus is noted for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal medicine.
